article_title: Vermont’s Effort to Gather Data on Health-Care Costs Faces Supreme Court Test
article_text:
WASHINGTON—State efforts to curb health-care costs faced a test at the Supreme Court on Wednesday as insurance providers argued that federal law bars states from requiring insurers to supply data on the costs and outcomes of their services.

Vermont’s Green Mountain Care Board requires insurers to provide information on payments made to medical providers, hoping that by knowing what is paid for health care it can find ways to keep costs in check and improve efficiency and quality of care. At least 18 other states already...

twitter.description: State efforts to curb health-care costs faced a test at the Supreme Court on Wednesday as Liberty Mutual argued that federal law bars states like Vermont from requiring health insurers to supply data on the costs and outcomes of their services.
twitter.title: Vermont’s Effort to Gather Data on Health-Care Costs Faces Supreme Court Test
